So from two data points, I don't believe he exercised. The first one is because the basis here doesn't match up. Again, if he exercised using this 40,000 and 10, his additional basis would have had to have been 20609 and it wasn't. So that's the first part. The second part is that he would have given up 920,000 dollars. And I just I know that he's not in it for the money is not super concerned, but I also don't think he's in the business of just throwing money away, which is literally what that is. It's just throwing it away. So I think that he wanted to monetize the calls before expiration. This is one of the few instances where he actually exited relatively early. Most of the other periods he exited when the option still had like no time left. So this is why I don't think he exercised his options. And this is why I think that the math leads us towards him selling the options and then buying the shares on the market. That's what I think. I think Magnum says, well, he did end up giving up being a millionaire, a billionaire, but makes sense.
